name: Government Data Verification
description: Verifies government data through agency methodology assessment, independence checks, and cross-referencing with independent measurements. Based on intelligence community multi-source fusion principles.

task.purpose: Identify the specific agency and methodology behind "{evidence.description}". Government data has institutional credibility but is subject to political influence and methodological limitations — understanding the methodology is the foundation for all subsequent assessment.
keyTasks: Identify the specific agency, department, and dataset referenced in the evidence.
Find the published methodology: how data was collected, sampling approach, instruments used, collection frequency.
Check if the methodology has been peer-reviewed or independently audited.
Note the date range covered and any known data gaps or limitations.
task.endState: Agency and dataset identified, methodology documented, peer-review status confirmed, and date range/gaps recorded.

requiredOutputs.description: Whether methodology was peer-reviewed or audited

task.purpose: Determine whether {parent.agency}'s data on {parent.dataset} may have been subject to political pressure or institutional conflicts. Government data is only as reliable as the agency's independence.
keyTasks: Research whether this agency's data or conclusions have been subject to political pressure or interference (documented cases).
Check if agency leadership during the reporting period had conflicts of interest.
Research whether the agency's methodology changed and whether changes coincided with political transitions.
Check for whistleblower reports or OIG (Office of Inspector General) investigations related to this data.
task.endState: Political influence assessment completed: interference documented or absence noted, leadership conflicts checked, methodology change timeline mapped, whistleblower/OIG reports cataloged.

requiredOutputs.description: Whether documented political interference was found
Whether agency leadership had relevant conflicts

task.purpose: Cross-reference {parent.agency}'s data against independent measurements. Multi-source convergence is the gold standard for data reliability — if independent sources agree, the data is likely sound regardless of political context.
keyTasks: Find independent measurements of the same thing: academic studies, NGO measurements, international agency data, private sector data.
Compare values between government data and independent sources.
If discrepancies exist, research which measurement is more methodologically sound.
Document the degree of convergence or divergence across all sources.
task.endState: Independent sources identified and compared. Convergence or divergence documented with assessment of which measurement is most reliable.

requiredOutputs.description: Which source is more methodologically sound
